title: Sr. Systems Engineer
description:
Own Your Future.

Modern Technology Solutions, Inc. (MTSI) is searching for a Sr. Systems Engineer to join our team. You will provide technical and programmatic advice and support services on a suite of advanced weapon system, sensor, and computer processing related technologies and programs.

Why is MTSI known as a Great Place to Work?

Interesting Work: Our co-workers support some of the most important and critical programs to our national defense and security. Values: Our first core value is that employees come first. We challenge our co-workers to provide the highest level of support and service, and reward them with some of the best benefits in the industry. 100% Employee Ownership: we have a stake in each other's success, and the success of our customers. It's also nice to know what's going on across the company; we have company wide town-hall meetings three times a year. Great Benefits - Most Full-Time Staff Are Eligible for: Starting PTO accrual of 20 days PTO/year + 10 holidays/yearFlexible schedules6% 401k match with immediate vestingSemi-annual bonus eligibility (July and December)Company funded Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP) - a separate qualified retirement accountUp to $10,000 in annual tuition reimbursementOther company funded benefits, like life and disability insuranceOptional zero deductible Blue Cross/Blue Shield health insurance planTrack Record of Success: We have grown every year since our founding in 1993
Modern Technology Solutions, Inc. (MTSI) is a 100% employee-owned engineering services and solutions company that provides high-demand technical expertise in Digital Transformation, Modeling and Simulation, Rapid Capability Development, Test and Evaluation, Artificial Intelligence, Autonomy, Cybersecurity and Mission Assurance.

MTSI delivers capabilities to solve problems of global importance. Founded in 1993, MTSI today has employees at over 20 offices and field sites worldwide.

For more information about MTSI, please visit www.mtsi-va.com.

Responsibilities

As a Sr. Systems Engineer with MTSI you will provide technical and programmatic advice and support services on a suite of advanced weapon system, sensor, and computer processing related technologies and programs. This position will be located in the National Capital Region (NCR).

Your essential job functions will include but may not be limited to:

You will Interact daily with Air Force program managers and aerospace industry subject matter experts to assist the government with technical assessments, strategic planning, and engineering evaluations.

Qualifications

Requirements:

10+ years' of relevant DoD work experience in Systems Engineering.Knowledge of DoD and/or USAF systems engineering processes and procedures for ACAT 1 and 2 systems, and contracts experience in preparing SOWs/RFPs and performing technical evaluations of proposals.Recent DoD and/or USAF Special Access Programs experience and DoD and/or USAF Headquarters staffing processes.

Desired Requirements

Strong Background in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Communication/Electronic systems, and/or distributed Weapon System Architectures.

Education Requirements

BS Degree 

Clearance Requirements

TS/SCI with previous SAP experience.U.S. Citizenship is required for this position.

title: Event Sales Coordinator
description:
About Our Company:
Over the last 20 years, GIG has scaled past our roots in Australia expanding into 5 countries, becoming a global leader in customer-facing marketing efforts. In just 4 years in the USA, GIG leads the industry in delivering new & high-quality customers for our clients. We work with well known nonprofit organizations, specializing in branding, customer acquisition, and expansion for our clients. We have also diversified into the commercial sector with success for numerous clients in recent years – growing our market share at a rapid pace.At GIG, we believe in creating exceptional results for our clients by developing a customer-centric and growth-minded team of sales and marketing experts. We always strive to create a work environment that fosters personal and professional growth, teamwork and the opportunity to network with all of our global offices. 
We truly believe in the power of our people and our career development programs focus on employee growth ahead of organizational growth. We promote from within, having built our entire global leadership team organically. As a result, we value mentorship over management & we are passionate about working with employees of all experience levels. Simply put, GIG Cares!
We offer a great base plus uncapped commissions, healthcare, travel opportunities, both domestic and international and value a healthy work/life balance. We truly believe that our career development programs can propel our future leaders to income and advancement levels that would require a degree and 3-5 years of experience elsewhere, within their first year. 
We hope to welcome you into our growing organization! Client Representative – Entry Level Marketing, Sales & ManagementTexas Nonprofit Division – DFW Office
About the Role:We are seeking a self-starting marketing representative to engage customers on behalf of our non-profit clients. The ideal candidate will thrive as a customer-obsessed ambassador for our clients’ brands; will influence and build upon the success we have had to date. Specifically, the ideal candidate will be excited to represent and promote organizations in the nonprofit sector, driving new donor acquisition and awareness through our multiple, established face-to-face channels. 
Initial Responsibilities:Engage, educate and empower potential new donors for our nonprofit clients in a customer facing environment.Acquire and onboard new donors to achieve fundraising targets for our nonprofit clients, week over week. Create opportunities to promote the nonprofit’s mission and current campaign to potential donors by fostering relationships with our corporate and community partners.Achieve and evaluate key performance indicators.
Responsibilities can quickly evolve to include:Developing campaign strategies; coordinating team schedules and training programs.Leading & developing small to medium size teams.Evaluating success metrics and driving campaign performance.Reviewing performance data to improve processes and establish metrics for individual growth.Leading regular team meetings & attending off-site conferences with support staff and company leadership.
Characteristics we look for : Ambitious and goal orientedPersonableA bit competitiveValues personal and professional developmentAbility to take initiative
What this role is not : Graphic or digital design.Social media marketing.Call center based.Office based.100% commission.
Required Qualifications:Ability to communicate effectively with customers and management.Adept at solving problems and creating impactful solutions.Ability to apply critical thinking and strong people skills.Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.Some hospitality, retail or other customer service or sales oriented experience. Bachelor’s degree or HS Diploma with equivalent work experience.
Desired additional experience:Prior leadership experience; demonstrated ability to lead a team to meet goals.Expert at identifying and executing successful customer relationships.Ability to excel autonomously as well as contribute to a healthy team environment.
Working at GIG We Provide:Base + uncapped commission & bonuses with first year OTE average $45,000-$60,000 Full Medical Benefits available after 60 days.Paid holidays & PTOOpportunities to travel, both domestic & international.Clear paths to promotions.Leadership development and mentorship.Regular Team events & outings.Inclusive, supportive, and diverse work environmentHealthy work life balance.

title: Advanced Acquisition Analyst
description:
Own Your Future.

Modern Technology Solutions, Inc. (MTSI) is seeking an Advanced Acquisition Support Analyst to join our team. You will provide full-time on-site dedicated support to the Missile Defense Agency (MDA) Space Systems (MDA/SS), located at Schriever SFB, CO (Missile Defense Integration Operations Center (MDIOC).

Why is MTSI known as a Great Place to Work?

Interesting Work: Our co-workers support some of the most important and critical programs to our national defense and security. Values: Our first core value is that employees come first. We challenge our co-workers to provide the highest level of support and service, and reward them with some of the best benefits in the industry. 100% Employee Ownership: we have a stake in each other's success, and the success of our customers. It's also nice to know what's going on across the company; we have company wide town-hall meetings three times a year. Great Benefits - Most Full-Time Staff Are Eligible for: Starting PTO accrual of 20 days PTO/year + 10 holidays/yearFlexible schedules6% 401k match with immediate vestingSemi-annual bonus eligibility (July and December)Company funded Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP) - a separate qualified retirement accountUp to $10,000 in annual tuition reimbursementOther company funded benefits, like life and disability insuranceOptional zero deductible Blue Cross/Blue Shield health insurance planTrack Record of Success: We have grown every year since our founding in 1993
Modern Technology Solutions, Inc. (MTSI) is a 100% employee-owned engineering services and solutions company that provides high-demand technical expertise in Digital Transformation, Modeling and Simulation, Rapid Capability Development, Test and Evaluation, Artificial Intelligence, Autonomy, Cybersecurity and Mission Assurance.

MTSI delivers capabilities to solve problems of global importance. Founded in 1993, MTSI today has employees at over 20 offices and field sites worldwide.

For more information about MTSI, please visit www.mtsi-va.com.

Responsibilities

You will be supporting several innovative, highly technical, and fast-paced space sensor developmental programs. These critical programs will procure, test, and deliver national space assets to the warfighting Combatant Commands.

Specific Skills Required

Working knowledge of applicable DoD acquisition directives to support the development of Missile Defense System (MDS) acquisition policy, plans, processes, procedures, and guidance for MDS development and fieldingExperience with developing Acquisition Plans, Justification and Approvals, Request for Proposal packages, Statements of Work, and Contract Data Requirement ListsAbility to interpret MDA acquisition guidance to support acquisition planning and MDS program integrationSupport the development of acquisition implementing/operating instructions, directives, plans and policiesExpertise in strategic planning, acquisition strategy development, and development of key acquisition documentation to support acquisition strategy approval and executionPrepare planning documents to coordinate integrated acquisition strategies within the MDS and OGA partnersPrepare MDS acquisition documentation and executive-level decision papersDemonstrated experience supporting and interacting on a daily basis with high level DoD Officials (O-6 and above, GS-15/NH-4 equivalent), sitting on-site with the DoD Program Office and ability to deliver products successfully in a fast paced environment (on demand)Prepare and staff Directorate of Acquisitions actions for functional and technical review and comment; perform internal and external Agency coordination and reportingDemonstrated capability to develop reports, information papers, decision papers, and briefings for senior leadership and external stakeholder leadershipExperience in cost, schedule and performance management for a space-based program and/or a DoD systemPossess knowledge of acquisition processes/activities required to support the evaluation of contract performance against the program baselinesExperience translating technical requirements into contract requirementsCapable of working independently or leading cross-functional teams to research, track, and complete ad hoc tasks associated with the PWSDemonstrated ability to organize and execute meeting logistics and represent the Directorate at higher-level meetings as requiredAbility to track, coordinate, and manage information requests from both internal and external agenciesAbility to collaborate and both troubleshoot problems and support the needs of the program office(s)Ability to draft and brief complex acquisition solutions, e.g., Other Transactions (OT) and hybrid acquisitions or equivalentOutstanding written and oral communication skills

Qualifications

BA/BS in related field with 10+ years relevant experience in Program Integration, Acquisition, Budget, or Program Management; Prefer experience at MDA, OGA, or DoD; MA/MS, PMP or DAWIA Level III certification may substitute for 3 years of experience10 years directly supporting a Federal Acquisition or DoD program(s) as an acquisition/program analyst overseeing cost, schedule, and performance5 years in a DoD program management and integration environment providing strategic level analysis, communications, and staff coordination for executive level review

Desired Skills

Experience with Other Transactions Authority contract mechanismsExperience in one or more program offices is highly desirableProficiency in MS Office suiteCurrent Secret Security Clearance Required and eligible for TS/SCI

Please Note: U.S. Citizenship is required for most MTSI positions.

Pay Range

The pay range for this position in Colorado is $90,000/year to $150,000/year; however, base pay offered may vary depending on established government contract rates, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience, and other factors. MTSI also offers a full range of medical, financial, and other benefits, dependent on the position offered. This information is provided per the Colorado Equal Pay Act. Base pay information is based on market location. Applicants should apply via MTSI’s internal or external careers site.

title: Warehouse Supervisor - Weekend Shift
description:
Weekend Shift: Saturday/Sunday 6:00am-6:30pm and Monday 7:30am-8:00pm
Position OverviewThe Warehouse Supervisor is responsible for directing the daily activities of the Distribution Center including labor scheduling, supervision, and proper utilization of space, equipment, and manpower. Key responsibilities include staffing, training, operations, inventory management, maintenance of the facility and equipment, implementation of safety, security, housekeeping and sanitation programs, budgeting, and customer service.
 The Supervisor serves as an interface and coordinator among the DC and manufacturing operations, customer service, IT, Human Resources, and Transportation. The Operations Supervisor is accountable for the safe, efficient, and economical operation of the facility and equipment. Duties and ResponsibilitiesOPERATIONS: Develop and direct shift operations to ensure the efficient and cost-effective operation and utilization of the shift. Plan and schedule all services including receiving, storing, shipping, handling returned/damaged goods, and if applicable assembly of finished goods, maintenance, and administrative activities to ensure customer requirements are met in an efficient manner. Plan daily labor needs based on work volume and input from facility leadership. Make recommendations to senior management on programs to improve operations. Passion for continuous improvement with experience in change management. COMMUNICATIONS: Conduct daily shift meetings. Interact with the DC Manager, Director of Distribution, Assistant Distribution Center Manager and facility managers and supervisors to establish goals and objectives. Interact with Finance, Human Resources, Transportation and Information Systems, Department Managers, Supervisors and all employees.LABOR MANAGEMENT: Direct the operations of the shift personnel to achieve prescribed objectives. In collaboration with Human Resources, develop and maintain a productive work team by creating programs for hiring, training and professional development. Apply sound communications and motivational techniques in supervising, coaching and disciplining subordinates. Experience in developing and managing highly productive teams and individuals.SAFETY: Ensure the safety of all personnel, equipment and property. Provide safety instructions to personnel as needed. Report all work-related injuries to Human Resources immediately. Provide immediate medical attention (Certified First Responders) to injured employees as necessary. Assure compliance with OSHA and MSDS regulations.HOUSEKEEPING: Manage programs to keep tools and equipment in designated areas; Maintain a high standard of cleanliness throughout the facility; areas around the outside of the facility; store finished goods in neat straight rows inside painted perimeters and/or defined areas; supervise the cleaning of restrooms and break rooms; maintain strict rodent and pest control; assure compliance with appropriate government regulations.SHIPPING/RECEIVING: Assure that customer orders are picked and shipped in a timely fashion within prescribed cost levels and processed accurately according to corporate guidelines in compliance with the Sarbanes-Oxley Act for proper accountability. Develop and implement an effective receiving operation that minimizes cost and ensures receiving paperwork is processed accurately and promptly.REPORTING: Ensure the accurate and timely preparation, processing, distribution and retention of all necessary reports and records regarding DC operations. Generate weekly efficiency/productivity reports, as well as other distribution reports as needed. Education, Skills and ExperienceBachelor’s degree in business or logistics preferred, Industrial Engineering, Logistics, or comparable job experience.A minimum of (5) years of distribution experience in warehousing, shipping, and receiving processes, procedures and systems.Computer skills including Intermediate skills in MS Excel such as creating graphs and charts. Intermediate skills in MS Word such as using tables, columns and breaks, graphics, fields, headers and footers, working with margins, page orientation, and spelling/grammar. Intermediate skills in MS Power Point.Ideal candidate will have two or more years of user experience in SAP.Working knowledge of the distribution industry including industrial equipment operation, picking, packing, and receiving put-away methodologies.Strong interpersonal skills are necessary.Material handling experience required.Experience with Lean methodologies a plus.

title: Financial Services Representative
description:
Inclusively is partnering with a financial services company to hire a Financial Services Representative. **Please note: this role is NOT an internal position with Inclusively but with the partner company.**
ABOUT INCLUSIVELY:Inclusively is a digital tech platform that connects candidates with disabilities, who may benefit from workplace accommodations, to inclusive employers. This includes all disabilities under the ADA, including mental health conditions (e.g. anxiety, depression, PTSD), chronic illnesses (e.g. diabetes, Long COVID), and neurodivergence (e.g. autism, ADHD). Applicants with one or more of these conditions are encouraged to apply; Inclusively does not require applicants to disclose their specific disability.
Our service team is at the heart of our firm’s commitment to helping clients own their financial futures. In this exciting role, you’ll learn to educate clients about investment strategies, trading tools, market mechanics, and retirement choices. You’ll engage with, and be an advocate for, clients when answering inbound calls, taking ownership, and tackling complex issues to offer the best possible solution. You’ll also take charge of your own professional journey by attending the company Service Academy, which provides you with the paid training, study time, and support you need to obtain your Securities Industry Essentials and FINRA Series 7 & 63 licenses. If you are eager to pursue a career in finance, enjoy working in a team setting, and share our passion for serving clients - this role is for you. 
We offer a competitive pay and bonus package. Starting compensation for this location begins at $51,400 during training, plus an annual bonus opportunity of 10% of your base pay and other eligible earnings. Employees have the potential to increase their total compensation to $58,740 ($53,400 base, plus 10% bonus opportunity depending on individual/corporate performance) within their 1st year upon obtaining the required Licensing and achieving performance-based pay increases.
What you haveIf you’re not a finance expert, that’s okay! People coming from many different experiences have found tremendous success here at our company. Successful candidates will have a growth mindset, a willingness to learn, and a passion for serving others. At our company, we strive to make a difference in people's lives through our innovative solutions and world-class service.

BenefitsA competitive and flexible package designed to empower you for today and tomorrow. We offer a competitive and flexible package designed to help you make the most of your life at work and at home—today and in the future.

title: Entry Level Technical Recruiter
description:

title: Sr. Director of Creative and Brand - Photography - CUUP and Eloquii
description:
FULLBEAUTY Brands™ is the premier fashion and lifestyle destination for the plus size customer. We are an online and catalog marketplace offering a curated collection of the finest family of plus size brands and thousands of products.
The Sr. Director of Creative and Brand mentors the creative team to ensure that all phases of the creative design process meet each brand’s expectations; this includes concept development, email layout and on figure/off figure photography direction, video & social media content. The Sr. director of creative and brand must be able to interpret and transform customer information into creative assets that emotionally connect with each brand while conveying product attributes while maintaining a highly elevated taste level. Experience in the luxury market preferred.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:• Manage the overall creative concepts for the brands utilizing customer research, brand positioning and input from VP of Creative & Design to develop innovative messages that clearly articulate the brand voice and product attributes to the customer.• communicate the teams creative vision to cross-functional partners• Work closely with the VP of Creative & Design to ensure the creative assets align to the collection strategies & requirements to drive sales.• Manage the brand creative teams to execute the creative concepts, layout designs and photography for omni channels in an innovative, modern way that is consistent and unique to the brand.• Strategize best practices for the entire creative team.• Design creative messaging for all digital initiatives including website updates, emails, social media banner ads, etc. with ability to interpret and transform brand positioning and print visuals into a digital platform.• Manages & works directly on all stages of planning and art direction of on figure/off figure photography in partnership with the senior creative manager, producer, copy writer & graphic designers. This includes talent selection, set selection and on-location shoot management in partnership with the photo production team.• Ensure the creative and product copy convey a cohesive message that will drive sales.• Lead the Photo Production teams to ensure proper follow-through of creative concept, talent selection, budget, and timeliness.•Responsible for maintain the total creative budget and aligning on yearly and quarterly goals with the VP of creative & design•Collaborate with brand marketing on presenting digital social content strategies to VP of Creative and Design.• Participate with design, marketing & merchandising teams to continue and enhance processes for the creative presentation of the brand.• Partner with Digital team on timely deliverables for online assets and paid marketing ads• Cultivate talent & mentor direct reports by further elevating their conceptual development, photography direction, design and creative copywriting skills – conduct timely coaching sessions to provide feedback regarding growth & development for next level opportunities• Clearly communicate expectations, and ensure the team has all tools needed to deliver on their responsibilities
  MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:• Bachelor’s Degree (BA or BFA) is required.• 12+ years of experience in creating exceptional commercial creative content across design, photography, copy and creative management. Some prior editorial experience is a plus.• 10+ years of management experience building, leading and guiding creative teams.• Strong conceptual thinker with comprehensive experience in digital creative execution in DTC with high end experience.• Proficient in Desktop Publishing file formats in creative suite.• Hands-on experience directing digital on/off figure fashion photography with an editorial lense.• Excellent organization skills and attention to detail• An innovator who can identify need for, and develop, practical processes and solutions that facilitate organizational effectiveness and efficiency• Ability to work under tight deadlines and plan, organize and carry out multiple initiatives• Results-oriented, high-energy leader with the vision and management skills required to influence, direct and motivate both direct and indirect teams• Team-oriented, collaborative and has strong interpersonal relationship skills at all levels, including executive leadership, management and associates• Approaches their role with a high degree of honesty, loyalty and integrity and adheres to high ethical standards through leading by example• Ability to travel both domestically and internationally

FULLBEAUTY Brands™ is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.

title: SMB Account Executive (Hybrid, San Francisco or NYC)
description:
Everyone is welcome at Handshake. We know diverse teams build better products and we are committed to creating an inclusive culture built on a foundation of respect for all individuals. We strongly encourage candidates from non-traditional backgrounds, historically marginalized or underrepresented groups to apply.

Your Impact

We’re looking for an SMB Account Executive to join our Employer Sales Team at Handshake, the only all-in-one early talent recruiting platform. In this role you will connect Employers to students and alumni to democratize access to opportunity. You will be given an account list and will be responsible for managing a full-cycle sales process from prospecting to closing. This includes (but isn’t limited to) account prioritization, prospecting and outreach, uncovering customer objectives and aligning to Handshake’s value, and finally creating urgency to drive deadlines and accountability. Handshake is a fast-paced environment and it’s an exciting time. In order to be successful you must embrace change management, have a positive mindset, and be a problem-solver.

Your Role

Exceed quarterly and annual quota targetsDevelop and cultivate relationships with senior executives at the Director, VP, and C-level within your accountsLeverage internal tools and resources to prospect, nurture, and close new business Responsible for accurately forecasting business on monthly/quarterly/yearly basis Interact and collaborate cross-functionally to build and grow our multi-sided talent marketplaceWork independently while also up-leveling and supporting your teamBe customer first and take a consultative approach to selling Handshake’s valueNote: this is a hybrid position with 3 days a week in our San Francisco or NYC, and 2 days a week remote.

Your Experience

2-3 years of sales experience in SaaS with 1+ year of closing experienceProven track record of quota attainment in closing sales role for 1+ yearA strong history of quota attainment and can articulate at least 1 example of a customer story from prospect to closed wonExperience operating in a high-growth business environment like HandshakeClear written and verbal communicationPre-sales experience: prioritization and outreach including scalable email communication and 1:1 customizationSales Experience: discovery including 2nd and 3rd level pain, demonstrating and explaining ROI, and having the ability to hold customers to deadlines and generate urgency to drive deals forward in the sales cycleExperience preparing sales proposals, forecasting, and account planningDemonstrates enthusiasm for working outside of scope to enrich processes and have an impact on larger business objectives Willing to work out of our San Francisco or NYC office 3 days a week

Bonus Areas Of Expertise

Knowledge of how online recruiting technology works - and the ability to explain it in ordinary termsCompleted formal sales training programs, has knowledge of sales methodologies (i.e Challenger, MEDDIC, Sandler, etc), and/or utilizes additional resources like books or podcasts to up level skills Previous SDR or BDR experience before being an AEAE experience selling HR or recruiting software

Compensation Range

$130,000-$140,000 OTE + Equity 

For cash compensation, we set standard ranges for all U.S.-based roles based on function, level, and geographic location, benchmarked against similar stage growth companies. In order to be compliant with local legislation, as well as to provide greater transparency to candidates, we share salary ranges on all job postings regardless of desired hiring location. Final offer amounts are determined by multiple factors, including geographic location as well as candidate experience and expertise, and may vary from the amounts listed above.

About Us

Handshake is the #1 place to launch a career with no connections, experience, or luck required. The platform connects up-and-coming talent with 750,000+ employers - from Fortune 500 companies like Google, Nike, and Target to thousands of public school districts, healthcare systems, and nonprofits. In 2022 we announced our $200M Series F funding round. This Series F fundraise and valuation of $3.5B will fuel Handshake’s next phase of growth and propel our mission to help more people start, restart, and jumpstart their careers.

When it comes to our workforce strategy, we’ve thought deeply about how work-life should look here at Handshake. With our Hub-Based Remote Working strategy, employees can enjoy the flexibility of remote work, whilst ensuring collaboration and team experiences in a shared space remains possible. Handshake is headquartered in San Francisco with offices in Denver, New York, London, and Berlin and teammates working globally.

Check out our careers site to find a hub near you!

What we offer

At Handshake, we'll give you the tools to feel healthy, happy and secure.

Benefits Below Apply To Employees In Full-time Positions.

💰 Equity and ownership in a fast-growing company.🍼 16 Weeks of paid parental leave for birth giving parents & 10 weeks of paid parental leave for non-birth giving parents.💝 Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision policies including LGTBQ+ Coverage. We also provide resources for Mental Health Assistance, Employee Assistance Programs and counseling support.💻 Handshake offers $500/£360 home office stipend for you to spend during your first 3 months to create a productive and comfortable workspace at home.📚 Generous learning & development opportunities and an annual $2,000/£1,500/€1,850 stipend for you to grow your skills and career.💰 Financial coaching through Origin to help you through your financial journey.🛜 Monthly internet stipend and a brand new MacBook to allow you to do your best work.🚃 Monthly commuter stipend for you to expense your travel to the office (for office-based employees).🥗 Free lunch provided twice a week across all offices.🤝 Referral bonus to reward you when you bring great talent to Handshake.

(US-specific Benefits, In Addition To The First Section)

🏦 401k Match: Handshake offers a dollar-for-dollar match on 1% of deferred salary, up to a maximum of $1,200 per year.🏝 All full-time US-based Handshakers are eligible for our flexible time off policy to get out and see the world. In addition, we offer 8 standardized holidays, and 2 additional days of flexible holiday time off. Lastly, we have a Winter #ShakeBreak, a one-week period of Collective Time Off.🍼 Lactation support: Handshake partners with Milk Stork to provide a comprehensive 100% employer-sponsored lactation support to traveling parents and guardians.

(UK-specific Benefits, In Addition To The First Section)

🏦 Pension Scheme: Handshake will provide you with a workplace pension, where you will make contributions based on 5% of your salary. Handshake will pay the equivalent of 3% towards your pension plan, subject to qualifying earnings limits.🏝 Up to 25 days of vacation to encourage people to reset, recharge, and refresh, in addition to 8 bank holidays throughout the year.🤝 Regular offsites each year to bring the team together + opportunity to travel to our HQ in San Francisco.🛍️ Discounts across various high street retailers, cinemas and other social activities exclusively for Handshake UK employees.

(Germany-specific Benefits, In Addition To The First Section)

🏝 25 days of annual leave + we have a Winter #ShakeBreak, a one-week period of Collective Time Off across the company.🤝 Regular offsites each year to bring the team together + opportunity to travel to our HQ in San Francisco once a year.🧘 Urban sports club membership offering access to a diverse network of fitness and wellness facilities.🛍️ Discounts across various high street retailers, cinemas and other social activities exclusively for Handshake Germany employees.

For roles based in Romania: Please ask your recruiter about region specific benefits.

Looking for more? Explore our mission, values and comprehensive US benefits at joinhandshake.com/careers.

Handshake is committed to providing reasonable accommodations in our recruitment processes for candidates with disabilities, sincerely held religious beliefs or other reasons protected by applicable laws. If you need assistance or reasonable accommodation, please reach out to us at people-hr@joinhandshake.com.

title: Staff Accountant
description:
About Ping Identity:

At Ping Identity, we believe in making digital experiences both secure and seamless for all users, without compromise. We call this digital freedom. And it's not just something we provide our customers. It's something that inspires our company. People don't come here to join a culture that's built on digital freedom. They come to cultivate it.

Our intelligent, cloud identity platform lets people shop, work, bank, and interact wherever and however they want. Without friction. Without fear.

While protecting digital identities is at the core of our technology, protecting individual identities is at the core of our culture. We champion every identity. One of our core values, Respect Diversity, reminds us to celebrate differences so you are empowered to bring your authentic self to work.

We're headquartered in Denver, Colorado and we have offices and employees around the globe. We serve the largest, most demanding enterprises worldwide, including more than half of the Fortune 100. At Ping Identity, we're changing the way people and businesses think about cybersecurity, digital experiences, and identity and access management.

If you want to build your career within an industry-leading, fast-growing technology company, then Ping is the right place for you. As a Staff Accountant, you will have a focus on technical accounting, as well as involvement in accounting transactions spanning both revenue and general ledger, with opportunities to work cross-functionally with stakeholders throughout the business. Candidates for this position are self-motivated, hungry to learn, and not afraid of a challenge. You will report to the Accounting Supervisor.

You will:

Participate in the upfront deal review process to assess quotes for accuracy and accounting implications prior to execution by customerConduct research on accounting transactions and prepare written accounting memos for review by management and external auditorsCollaborate with the Product, Finance, Legal, and Sales teams on product readiness initiatives to ensure appropriate accounting treatmentAssist with special projects impacting the broader accounting organizationStay up to date with emerging accounting pronouncements and industry trends, assessing their impact on the organizationParticipate in the month-end close process, including processing multi-element customer contracts, preparing monthly journal entries, and account reconciliations


You have:

A Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or equivalent experience 0-2 years of accounting experienceKnowledge of accounting principles and standardsEffective time management and prioritization skills, including project management to monitor project progress and ensure adherence to deadlinesExcellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to present technical information in a clear and concise manner


You have an advantage if:

CPA certification or working towards licensureFamiliarity with Netsuite as an ERPYou foster collaboration and teamwork through a positive attitudeYou embrace challenges and strive for continuous improvement You are adaptable, intellectually curious, and thrive in a fast-paced environment


Life at Ping:

We believe in and facilitate a flexible, collaborative work environment. We’re growing quickly, but remain true to the innovative, can-do startup values that got us here. Most importantly, we keep hiring talented, smart, fun, and genuinely nice people because that’s who we want to succeed with every day. 

Here are just a few of the things that make Ping special:

A company culture that empowers you to do your best work.Employee Resource Groups that create a sense of belonging for everyone.Regular company and team bonding events.Competitive benefits and perks.Global volunteering and community initiatives


Our Benefits:

Generous PTO & Holiday Schedule Parental LeaveProgressive Healthcare OptionsRetirement ProgramsOpportunity for Education Reimbursement Commuter Offset (Specific locations) 


Ping is the collective sum of all our individual experiences, backgrounds and influences and we pride ourselves in growing and learning together. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse environment where everyone’s individuality is respected and everyone has an Identity. In recruiting for new colleagues, we welcome the unique contributions you can bring and encourage you to be your best self.

We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected Veteran Status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

title: Project Manager
description:
Company DescriptionNewgard Development Group, founded by Harvey Hernandez, is a Miami-based real estate development company specializing in luxury buildings in centrally located neighborhoods. With over 50 years of combined experience in development, design, marketing, and construction, Newgard is known for its forward-thinking approach and commitment to innovative amenities. The company's recent projects include Natiivo Austin, Gale Residences Ft. Lauderdale Beach, BrickellHouse, Centro, and One Flagler among many others.
Role DescriptionThis is a full-time on-site role for a Project Manager in Downtown Miami, FL. The Project Manager provides professional support in the execution of planning, engineering, real estate development, including all large-scale development programs. 
Essential Duties and ResponsibilitiesProject Coordination: Assisting the SVP in coordinating various aspects of the project, including working with architects, contractors, and other stakeholders to ensure that the project stays on track and meets deadlines.Documentation: Managing project documentation, including contracts, permits, plans, and reports. This involves keeping records organized and up to date to facilitate efficient communication and decision-making.Budget and Cost Control: Assisting with budget tracking and cost control measures to ensure that the project remains within financial parameters. This could involve tracking expenses, reviewing invoices, and working to optimize resource allocation.Communication: Facilitating effective communication between different teams and stakeholders involved in the project, including internal teams, contractors, and regulatory authorities. This helps ensure that everyone is aligned and informed throughout the project lifecycle.Construction Site Visits and Inspections: Participating in site visits and inspections to monitor the progress of construction, identify any issues or discrepancies, and ensure that work is being carried out according to plans and quality standards. Review RFI’s and submittals.Quality Assurance: Supporting quality control efforts by monitoring the quality of construction work, materials, and finishes to ensure they meet the company's standards and the expectations of residents. Work with Forensic Engineer to track issues and resolve.Project Reporting: Compiling and preparing regular progress reports for project stakeholders, providing updates on milestones, timelines, and any issues that may impact the project's progress.Team Collaboration: Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including design, construction, marketing, and property management, to ensure a seamless transition from development to property operations.Learning and Development: Continuously staying updated on industry trends, regulations, and best practices in real estate development to contribute to the growth and success of the company.
QualificationsExperience in project management, expediting, and logistics managementStrong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneouslyKnowledge of construction industry standards and practicesExcellent communication and leadership skillsAbility to work collaboratively with cross-functional teamsBachelor's degree in a related field, such as Architecture, Engineering or Construction Management.

title: Solutions Engineer
description:
About FirstbaseRemote work is the biggest workplace revolution in history. Nothing will deliver a higher quality of life upgrade in the next decade. The biggest challenge is in providing the infrastructure that makes going remote easy for companies and Firstbase is delivering this core infrastructure that makes remote and hybrid work possible and sustainable for companies around the world.Today, we serve our customers by doing two things; We give businesses the ability to view, track and manage end-user assets, and we give workers the ability to pick and choose what they need for their unique circumstances, then return it when they leave. We help CIOs scale their IT teams by automating equipment lifecycle processes and we're already working with some of the world’s most interesting companies and delivering our service in dozens of countries. That said, we’re a fast growing start-up and there’s much to build. You’ll join at a time that has the benefit of momentum but you will have a broad opportunity to shape the future of our business.
About This PositionFirstbase is seeking a dynamic Solutions Engineer with strong collaboration and creativity skills to drive technical wins within our prospect base. This role will play a pivotal part in seizing the vast market opportunity presented by the shift to remote work.
Working hand in hand with our Account Executives, you’ll solve a unique challenge by coupling business automation objectives with physical supply chain challenges. In doing this you help businesses transform the way they manage their computer equipment and orchestrate onboarding and onboarding processes as well as other lifecycle events. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, clients, and stakeholders to create solutions & drive process improvements that ultimately lead to huge efficiency gains for our customers. 
This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere in the US.
Your ResponsibilitiesProactively take ownership in partnering with our Enterprise Sales teams and help the team hit their quarterly revenue goals.Serve as the go-to technical subject matter expert by consulting with prospects in their transition to remote work.Develop an understanding of desired customer technical and business outcomes as you help them design the solutions to achieve those goals.Deliver product demonstrations and technical presentations to C-Level audience and key stakeholders and articulate how they can drive value from the Firstbase platform.Work closely with internal teams to brainstorm solutions for overcoming key challenges, and develop impactful project scopes for provisioning end-users with computer equipment on a global scale.Lead value discovery sessions to understand the quantifiable impact on a clients current situation and develop value propositions on how Firstbase can benefit them.Secure technical wins by differentiating Firstbase against the competition, handling technical objections and mitigate any concerns that might block a deal from closing.Collaborate closely with our Product & Engineering teams to provide insights into customer feedback and desired technical solutions.Coordinate with our customer-facing Product team to ensure that solutions deliver on our external customers’ needs & roadmap and work seamlessly with our customer-facing product.Support Sales, Partner and Marketing teams with product knowledge and technical subject matter expertise.
What We're Looking ForYou are self-motivated and have the desire to learn and become an expert on equipment lifecycles, remote work strategy and operational supply chain.You have experience in integrations and process automation and have worked closely with customers before to define, document and implement their integration needs. You’re execution-oriented and obsess about the details to set the standard for high performance execution. You don’t let edge cases slip by and know how to make sure all the bases are covered.You’re creative and are constantly pushing the boundaries of what good looks like, iterating on existing content and best practices.You’re a servant leader who’s built strong, trusting relationships with your past teammates. You can prove it by pointing to ways you’ve helped internal customers become more successful in their jobs because of the solutions you’ve built. You have strong business value selling experience and familiarity with SaaS and Cloud technology.You’re motivated by the velocity and messiness of an early-stage startup, and you’re eager to contribute to help us constantly improve as we grow. And when it comes to how you show up: you’re deeply curious, self-directed, motivated to make an impact, and humble.
A Few Key Qualifications:3+ years relevant experience in a Solution Consultant (presales) roleExperience working with a diligent sales process methodology (MEDDIC, Value Selling, etc.)Strong technical background in software or IT and can quickly pick up technical knowledge in areas such as end user computing (Laptop configuration, MDM, imaging, compliance, Apple and Windows device management).Experience working in technical problems tied to integrations, automation.General understanding of API development Experience working directly with enterprise customers/in B2B SaaS to define their needs and help explore solutions for themExcellent overall communication skills — both written & verbalPragmatic approach to solving problems in a fast-paced startup environmentEagerness to work with a distributed team across the US and UK
We’re committed to building a culturally diverse team and strongly encourage you to apply regardless of your location, background, race, gender, sexual orientation or any other personally defining attribute. We encourage every person who is interested to apply. We’re imperfect communicators, so think of our job postings as the starting point for discussion rather than proof that you shouldn’t apply. Take the leap - you never know, you might just be the perfect person for one of our open roles, even if you don’t match 100% of the job description.

title: Partner Engagement Specialist
description:
Do you want to be part of a transformative educational technology company? Do you want to help make a difference within the education space? Our client helps develop and accelerate the learning potential of all students, and teachers throughout the world – Join Us!
Job Summary:
The Partner Engagement Specialist works on a team of highly skilled professional development specialists as the pedagogical expert, developing and organizing professional development for prospective and current clients. They provide account support, leading the pilot process, and maintaining customer feedback loop to the organization.
Responsibilities:Demonstrate subject matter expertise in learning, presenting, and providing in-person and virtual trainings for pre-kindergarten through 12th grade Math, Science, ELA, and Social Studies.Provides a baseline of customer service and account management for current clients, building trust and credibility with teachers, staff, and district leaders.Deliver professional development trainings, and continually track renewals across product lines.Develop and execute sales support strategies from interest to renewal.Manage successful district Pilots, keeping an eye on maximizing Pilot to Adoption conversion.Define customer segmentation, strategies and support models and identify opportunities for continuous improvement.Support a culture centered on partner engagement and act as voice of customer to sales, marketing, and product teams.Work collaboratively alongside other internal teams including Customer Service, Account Executives, and other Professional Development teams.Travel to deliver high quality professional development sessions to schools and districts: 30-50% possible travel.Other duties as required.

Requirements/QualificationLocation  Northeast (NY,NJ,MD,DE,PA,NJ CT,MA,RI,ME) Northwest (OR, WA, WY, MT, ID)Bachelor’s degree in Education, Sales, Marketing, Account Management or relevant field, and a minimum of 5+ years of sales or account management experience; or an acceptable combination of education and experience.A Master’s Degree in Education, Educational Technology or a relevant field is preferred.Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite and CRM applications required; experience with Salesforce preferred.Must have experience and subject matter expertise in one or more Core subject/content areas.Ability to understand on-going market trends and align campaigns to relevant projects and programs.Knowledge of industry accepted best practices and tools.Strong multi-tasking, project management, and proactive problem-solving abilities.Exceptional communication skills with strong verbal, written, and presentation proficiency.Highly organized with a strong attention to detail and excellent follow-through.

Our client is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce, providing equal employment and advancement opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or any other protected status.
As a global leader in Recruitment Process Outsourcing (RPO), Mogel RPO provides full-service business talent solutions. We help companies around the world find, hire, and train people who share their sense of purpose for the work they do.

title: Principal Systems Engineer, Satellites
description:
About Loft
Loft Federal is dedicated to providing the US national security space community with a rapid, affordable, and simplified pathway to orbit for any small satellite mission. We are a US-incorporated, wholly-owned subsidiary of Loft Orbital Solutions, Inc.
At Loft, we empower our team members with autonomy and ownership to tackle significant challenges, all while fostering a close-knit and supportive team environment. We believe that diversity, community, and inclusivity are the cornerstones of an open culture. We place significant value on kind, supportive, and team-oriented comrades with phenomenal problem-solving and communication skills.
Are you ready to embark on this exciting journey with us? As a Principal Satellite System Engineer, you'll embark on a dynamic journey, working on multiple satellite missions simultaneously, each boasting a unique multi-payload configuration. Your role will transcend boundaries as you collaborate seamlessly across various teams, including satellite operation software, payload interface software, mission engineering, and AIT.
In this role, you'll not only contribute to the success of our satellite missions but also have the opportunity to collaborate with a diverse and dynamic team, fostering innovation and driving impactful solutions in the ever-evolving space industry.
ResponsibilitiesCollaborate with other teams and our customers to meticulously develop and maintain technical budgets, ensuring optimal for spacecraft performance.Engage closely with internal teams and customers to craft and manage system requirements and verification techniques, ensuring alignment with project objectives.Play a pivotal role in shaping mission CONOPS, fostering the development of Service Level Agreements with Loft's esteemed customers.Provide invaluable support in program management and product management, serving as a liaison with customers on programmatic and schedule matters, ensuring smooth project execution.Lead the development of interface specifications, CONOPS definition, and other critical design documents, in collaboration with team members, driving project success.Extend your expertise to support test procedures and actively participate in the integration and test campaigns at our spacecraft manufacturer's site, ensuring adherence to rigorous quality standards.
RequirementsThe ability to obtain and maintain a Top Secret / Sensitive Compartmented Information (TS/SCI) clearance is required. Because this position requires a government security clearance, you must be a US Citizen for consideration.Additionally, an active DoD Secret clearance is required, with the capability to obtain Top Secret clearance. Active Top Secret clearance, particularly with recent experience within the last 2 years, or active involvement in Sensitive Compartmented Information (SCI) programs, is strongly desired.Preference will be given to candidates with 1) a DoD or Intelligence Community Top Secret background investigation with at least 3 years of eligibility remaining or CE status; and SCI eligibility with current experience in SCI programs, other control systems, and/or Special Access Programs, or 2) a current in-scope DoD SECRET background investigation with at least 3 years of eligibility remaining, or Continuous Evaluation (CE) status, along with willingness and ability to obtain a Top Secret clearance.
Experience and QualificationsYou enjoy being the face of the technical requirements and working with a team to deliver quality hardware.You pioneer innovation in aerospace by reshaping conventional practices in implementing and executing on System Engineering functions.You can demonstrate experience as a technical specialist, with a proven track record in specific spacecraft subsystems, coupled with comprehensive system-level experience encompassing Thermal, Structural, ADCS, RF Link, and more.You can showcase your hands-on experience in small satellite assembly, integration, and test campaigns, underscoring your proficiency at every stage of the process.You thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced development environment, where your ability to adapt and excel under pressure sets you apart.Prior experience delivering a spacecraft to orbit and/or space-qualified hardware to a customer.You have 5+ years of experience as a systems engineer or similar in the space industry.Preferred: Experience on RF and/or Electrical subsystems.Preferred: Proficient with STK.Plus: Experience with thermal analysis.
Our BenefitsHealth Benefits: Medical, dental, and vision insurance with a 100% company-paid option for employees and their dependents; Tax Deferred Programs, such as Flexible Spending (FSA) and Health Savings (HSA) Accounts, with an employer contribution to the HSA; 100% employer-paid Life, AD&D, Short-Term and Long-Term Disability Insurance; Fertility Planning and Care Assistance through Carrot Fertility, which provides comprehensive, inclusive fertility healthcare and family-forming benefits with financial supportFinancial Benefits: 401(k); Equity; Employee Referral Program; Relocation assistance, if applicablePaid Leave: Flexible Time Off (Vacation, Sick, Personal, Bereavement); 12 Paid Holidays; Fully-paid Parental Leave (14 weeks for birthing parents; 10 weeks for non-birthing parents); Working Parents SupportOther Perks: Daily catered lunches and snacks; International exposure to our team in France; Company off-sites, and many social events and celebrations
$150,000 - $205,000 a yearPer Colorado law, we are required to disclose the base compensation range for this role. This range is intentionally wide as we assess individuals based on their unique abilities and experience to find the best fit for our needs. Ultimately, your compensation will be determined by your education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities. 
In addition to a competitive salary and benefits package, you will find a truly remarkable culture guided by transparency and collaboration and work that is challenging and meaningful. We can't wait to meet you and see what you may add to our team!We are an equal opportunity employer. You will be considered for employment without attention to race, age, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, national origin or ancestry, veteran status, genetic information, disability, or pregnancy.
Research shows that while men apply to jobs where they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalized people tend to only apply when they meet 100% of the qualifications. At Loft, we value respectful debate and people who aren’t afraid to challenge assumptions. We strongly encourage you to apply, even if you don’t ‘check all the boxes'.

title: Project Engineer (Utilities)
description:
CPH is a multi-disciplined Engineering and Architectural design firm that ranks in the nation’s Top 500 Design Firms by ENR Magazine.
CPH has an opening in our Sanford, Florida office location for the following position:Project Engineer (EIT/EI) – Utilities
Hiring Bonus of up to $1,500 for selected candidate!
CPH is seeking a Project Engineer (EIT/EI) with an interest in the design of Utilities/or Land Development projects. 
Duties IncludeWorking under the responsible charge of a Professional Engineer as a member of a team in the design and preparation of technical reports, analysis/calculations and construction documents.Preparation of accurate presentation, design, details and construction documents.Preparation of permit applications and submittal packages to Agencies having jurisdiction.Coordination with clients, subconsultants, permitting agencies, utility providers, contractors and other parties associated with the project.Periodic travel to perform site investigations, and construction observation. Preparation of specifications, shop drawing review, field observations, preparation of inspection reports and other construction administration tasks. Collaboration with other firm engineers, architects, disciplines, project managers, and business development teams.Research, interpretation and implementation of relevant codes and client requirements.Implementation and utilization of CPH and client standards and templates.Review of documents prepared by others and implementation of project quality control.Development and adherence to project scope, schedules, and budgets.Management of clients and national account programs.
RequirementsB.S. in Civil/Environmental Engineering from an ABET accredited institution. EI/EIT Certification or commitment to obtain within 1 year of hire. Proficiency in MS Office, including Word, Excel and Outlook. AutoCAD experience is a plus.Ability to exercise critical thinking and good independent judgement.Stormwater management, water distribution and sanitary sewer collection system design education or experience. Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively with a team. Good social, communication, written and organizational skills.Ability to effectively multi-task and work on multiple projects while adhering to project schedules and budgets.Flexibility in work schedule to accommodate project deadlines.Detail oriented, quality conscious, reliable and self-motivated.Valid state-issued driver's license with a clean driving record.
Compensation & BenefitsDependent upon experience.CPH offers Medical, Dental, Vision and Long-Term Disability with a quality insurance company.Company Paid Life Insurance and Short-Term Disability.401K, Paid Personal Time Off, Paid Holidays, and Paid Paternal LeaveCPH is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action/Drug Free Work Environment Employer.
About CPHCPH is a multi-disciplined design firm that’s growing quickly across the country. Our diverse team of almost 400 individuals are the heartbeat of our company and the reason for our success. The unique contributions that people bring to our firm sets us apart and allows us to bring exceptional service to the communities and clients we serve.  At CPH, we offer small company culture with a big company presence. Founded by three visionaries in 1981, CPH has grown over 40 years to serve a long list of public and private clients across a spectrum of markets. Our comprehensive offering of services and broad reach has provided CPH the opportunity to team with clients in Building Stronger Communities Together across the nation and throughout the Caribbean. CPH is a part of the Trilon Group of companies. Its mission is to bring together North America's best infrastructure consulting firms in a collaborative environment with a People-First focus to accelerate their ability to deliver smart and sustainable solutions to clients. Through the partnership with Trilon, CPH professionals have the opportunity to network and share best practices with a host of other professionals across the country.  Our future is bright, and we need more talented professionals with an entrepreneurial spirit to grow with us! Could this be you?

title: Licensed Social Worker
description:
An amazing opportunity to join a rapidly growing team, in a fully remote position! My client is considered a "Pioneer" in the behavioral health field, and is looking to add Licensed Clinicians to join them in their mission to become the country's best behavioral health group.
Job SummaryThe Licensed Clinician is an associate level or independently licensed behavioral health clinician reporting to the Clinical Excellence Manager. This role provides evidence-based interventions via the Collaborative Care Model to individuals (pediatric and/or adult populations) experiencing mild to moderate symptoms and utilizes evidence-based therapeutic interventions to promote symptom reduction and optimal patient outcomes.  
Your ResponsibilitiesProvides care to patients, based on needs of assigned Care Pod, customizing treatment plan to individual patient needs.Supports and closely coordinates behavioral health care with and other treating providers.Completes relapse prevention plan with patients who are in remission.Educates patients about behavioral health/substance use disorders/treatment options.Establishes title: People Partner
description:
The Role{{{{:}}}}

As a People Partner, you're a trusted partner within the business and a key member of the team to ensure excellence in HR services and practices. You'll cultivate trusted relationships locally and globally, tackle strategic people matters while managing tactical matters, champion people-centric practices and culture.

As the trusted thought partner, you'll anticipate business needs collaborating with Global Centres of Excellence (ex{{{{:}}}} Communications, Inclusion, and L&D to name a few) to help to support our short and long-term goals for the region and in alignment with global People strategy. This presents an excellent chance for someone with a focus on high touch people partnering, working in collaboration with brilliant client groups and teams both globally and locally and enjoys operating both tactically and strategically. This role reports to the Director, People Partnering & Talent Acquisition.

Role Accountabilities{{{{:}}}}

Business Partnering

Operate in a generalist capacity across all employee groups, desire to have deep understanding of our teams and business to ensure high touch people partnering support Strong understanding of policy, practices and compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations, seeks to recommend best practices Strategic and tactical role within a rapidly growing business that continues to expand, which means a growing infrastructure with opportunity to continue to build on NA People tools to ensure we scale at pace Focus on all touchpoints of employee lifecycle, providing a magical journey to ensure the attraction, development/engagement and retention of talentMake recommendations in HR strategy for the NA business, and beyond, with a view of continuous improvementBe a key contributor in several strategic work-streams for NA and global People functionSupport key annual performance initiatives for NA client group. Support workforce planning to ensure we are setup for success and continue to grow responsiblySupport team efficiencies and ways of working for client group. Support local internal communications, learning and development in addition to inclusion in partnership with global centers of excellence 

Talent Management (Career Planning & Succession Planning)

Strong focus on internal talent care (career pathing, development, coaching) and ability to identify and further develop top internal talentPartner closely with Director, People & Talent Acquisition and Global Head of Talent on Career Planning and Succession Planning. Support narrowing talent gaps, increasing both retention and employee management through understanding of learning needsSupport development/succession plans for client group 

Employee Coaching and Advisement

Management of employee relations. Work directly with managers to discuss any people or team concerns, people issues or areas of development. 

Culture/Engagement

Gatekeeper of culture with a proximity to consumer group and business. Support vision of in-office activations and events in NY Magic Office tied to L&D & DE&I. Lead local ERG to support our continued focus on our culture, ensuring we are providing a best in class employee experience. Actively listen to their feedback as representatives of their functions to ensure actionable insight to improve the employee experience (in ways both big and small)!

Employee Lifecycle (In Partnership w/ People Ops)

Finger on the pulse of needs, anticipating them and providing proactive solutionsIn partnership with People Partnering and People Operations, help foster a magical employee experience and drive Global People strategy aligned with NA regional strategyWork collaboratively with regional/global partners and key stakeholders on day-to-day business responsibilities in addition to large scale regional/global initiativesActively identify gaps or development areas in People processes, and ways of working, proposing, and implementing changes necessary to cover risks and improve efficiencies. 

Reporting Relationships{{{{:}}}} Reports to Director - People & Talent Acquisition

Requirements

5+ years of experience. Spanish-speaking, bilingual preferredHigh empathy and high energy with a seek to understand mentalityStrong interpersonal skill set including ability to influence across all levels and regions. Significant, proven experience as an HRBP in corporate environment (Direct Talent and Generalist experience required supporting Corporate, Field and Retail)Proficiency with or the ability to quickly learn the organizations HRIS and talent management systemsProficient with Microsoft Office SuiteThrives in fast paced and ever-changing environmentStrong problem-solving ability with great attention to detailA role model for people-focused leadership standards and behaviors. Strong and deliberate grasp of situational leadership able to demonstrate an ability to embed and change behaviors at all levelsSelf-starter, ability to work independently and handle multiple priorities simultaneously with strong operations and project management skillsExperience in global companies both small and large (a plus if experience with companies in hyper growth mode!)

Benefits

Base Salary Range{{{{:}}}} $105,000.00 - $115,000.00**

Company Benefits{{{{:}}}}

Generous staff discount to use on all productsAccess to Tilbury Treats - our very own rewards platform allowing you to save money and gain ‘money can't buy' discounts on anything from gym memberships to cinema ticketsMedical, dental, and vision benefitsCommuter Benefits (Pre-tax)Flex Spending Account (FSA)Employee Assistance Program (EAP)401(k) with Company matchPaid Time OffBirthday PTOCharlotte Tilbury, in good faith, believes that this posted range of compensation is the accurate range for this role at the time of this posting**

title: Auto Glass Installation Technician Trainee
description:
Does this position interest you? You should apply – even if you don’t match every single requirement! We're known as an auto glass company. That's the focus of what we do. But beyond the glass, we're so much more. We'll help you build a fulfilling career and encourage you to have a life. Let us be the best place you'll ever work.

Do you like to be challenged? Have natural mechanical ability? Work independently, but also as part of a team with opportunities for growth and advancement?

Join Safelite as an Auto Glass Technician Trainee — the first step in becoming a certified auto glass technician on a nationally recognized team of expert installers! We’ll train you to install and repair auto glass, recalibrate car safety systems and provide service so great, it’s memorable. And you’ll get paid to learn it all!

We’re more than just a glass company. We empower our associates with the support they need to be efficient, to problem-solve and have an eye for detail, and most importantly, to deliver quality service and bring a little unexpected happiness to people’s lives.

This isn’t your typical desk job! You’ll be outdoors, working with your hands, and yes, that means working in an ever-changing environment with all sorts of weather conditions.

It’s time to start that new career you’ve been thinking about. Invest in yourself and learn more about our 3-month paid training program. Once on the job, your pay is evaluated every six months to ensure you’re rewarded for outstanding performance!

As a Technician Trainee you will: 

Be paid to learn and apprentice the Safelite way, through hands-on and classroom training, including: Installing and repairing auto glass Recalibrating automotive safety systems Providing additional services & products Study and pass testing to become a Safelite-certified Technician showing proficiency in installations, embracing a positive attitude and following taught techniques. Safely operate a company vehicle and company-issued tools utilized throughout the workday. 

What you’ll get:

Competitive weekly pay starting at $18/hour, increasing to $20/hour after training and certification. Earn $5/set of wiper blades when added for customer safety. Potential to be promoted in your first year! Pay starting at $22/hour as a Senior Tech & $25/hour as a Master Tech. Technician career levels determined based on performance metrics demonstrating efficiency, quality, and customer satisfaction. A benefits package valued at more than $10k*. Includes 401(k) plan with company matching, medical plans, paid time off, holidays & volunteer days. Program to buy additional PTO or sell unused time up to 16 hours. Up to $5,250 annually in tuition reimbursement. Paid training and all the tools and resources you'll need to be successful. View all our health, wealth, and life offerings at www.safelitebenefits.com. 

What you’ll need: (Not sure if you meet all the requirements? We encourage you to apply!)

Must be 18 years of age or older Valid state-issued driver’s license required Comfortable working outside (in a wide variety of weather conditions) on your feet for extended periods Ability to work scheduled days, with flexibility on start and end times to accommodate customer’s needs Ability to regularly lift up to 35 pounds and occasionally lift up to 50 pounds. High school diploma/GED/equivalent preferred; ability to read & write
