title: Associate Director, Business Analytics & Insights (US)
description:
Location of role  Rockville

 About the Company  Immunocore (NASDAQ: IMCR) is a pioneering, commercial-stage T cell receptor biotechnology company whose purpose is to develop and commercialize a new generation of transformative medicines which address unmet patient needs in oncology, infectious diseases and autoimmune disease. Our leaders in R&D are internationally recognised as some of the biotech industry’s most successful drug developers. We are creating not just an environment where great minds can interact but an innovation powerhouse answering the big questions.

Focused on delivering first-in-class biological therapies to patients, we have developed a highly innovative soluble TCR platform. Our ImmTAX molecules underpin a new generation of precision engineered drugs that harness the immune system to treat a broad spectrum of diseases with high unmet medical need, including oncology, infectious diseases and autoimmune diseases.

We strive to create a diverse and inclusive workplace, while seeking talented individuals to work with us across the many functions that will allow us to deliver new medicines to transform the lives of patients. You will work with outstanding people who together pioneer the research, development and commercialization of bi-specific TCR therapies. We aim to create an environment where individual contributions and initiatives can be maximized, while fostering a culture of collaboration, based on respect and integrity. We want each individual employee to own their career, as part of high-performing teams, and in the context of on-the-job and formal continuous development and training, as well as constructive feedback. We always strive to identify ways to improve what we do and how we do it, by asking questions, voicing opinions, exploring various approaches and staying connected with healthcare professionals, patients, academia and other key partners.

 Key Responsibilities  MAIN PURPOSE OF JOB

The Associate Director of US Business Analytics and Insights will be responsible to build and lead the analytics and insights in the US supporting KIMMTRAK and the melanoma platform. The associate director will develop and lead processes that drive commercial insights, timely and accurate business informatics, data analysis, and support field team excellence in the US. The function also oversees performance/sales dashboard and reporting. Additional responsibilities will include ensuring that consistent, efficient, effective, and high-quality insights support is provided to multiple stakeholders including Sales, Market Access, Marketing, IT, Finance, procurement and other internal departments. This high visibility role will present analytics and recommendations to senior management that influence short- and long-term planning on a routine basis, offering significant opportunities for career development.

Key Responsibilities

 Conduct market research to gain deep new insights informing our strategy and execution framework for our launched asset Lead insights/data strategy efforts to ensure accurate and reliable data assets are procured and onboarded Liaise with IT to further develop and deploy changes to relevant data, applications, and analytics Develop reports and analytics capabilities through key performances indicators that uncover business drivers and barriers, as well as allow for timely and actionable decision making by senior leadership Lead monthly/quarterly business reviews with leadership Lead weekly reporting and sales reporting for achievements versus target Liaise and manage day-to-day interactions with key external business partners and vendors that are critical to commercial functionality Assess field-team effectiveness to ensure optimal targeting, size and structure that supports commercial success Lead initial sales training on Operations data, systems, and tools for new hires and support on-going training workshops at national and regional meetings Drive the insights strategy informing the KIMMTRAK brand strategy plan for the US Own all HCP/Payer segmentation, targeting and positioning projects Identify and deliver on all post-launch training for the field-based teams Assist Ops Director in conducting implantation and strategy pull-through audits on the field team Assist marketing team in developing analytics behind omnichannel such as opt in rates, channel mix analytics Propose data mining projects to optimize the forecast

Other Duties

 Ensure all operational tasks are compliant and that appropriate analyses are performed to evaluate performance Management of varying projects that will influence cross-functional stakeholders Understand and adhere to regulatory, legal, and compliance guidelines

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY

No direct reports

Experience & knowledge

 At least 5 years of relevant work experience in the pharma/biotech field or experience in consulting for either the healthcare or banking/finance industry Strong knowledge of syndicated pharmaceutical industry data and experience integrating these data sources into an in-house data warehousing platform Expert in gathering new insights through innovative platforms and market research techniques Strong knowledge of best industry-standard CRM (Veeva preferred) and BI tools relevant to pharma industry Commercial sales launch experience (US oncology or specialty launch experience preferred) Preferred experience in sales and commercial operational roles Skilled at negotiating with business partners or management and influencing senior level leaders regarding matters of significance to the organization (business acumen) Established business planning and budgeting acumen and judgment Curious and data driven mindset, constantly questioning assumptions and working with a sense of urgency to enable the delivery of the best care to patients with cancer Must have extensive experience with US specialty distributor and/or IMS Sales data packages and the pharmaceutical sales process Competent in MS Excel, PowerPoint and Access and familiar with data warehouse environments.  Experience with PowerBI, SAS and SQL and adept at manipulating and analyzing data through Access and Excel Individual must work well in a dynamic environment and be able to recommend and implement process improvements and handle multiple projects simultaneously. 

Essential Competencies

 Hands on mentality and willingness to go beyond that classical description of the role Ability to multi-task several projects under tight deadlines Strong organization and prioritization skills. Project management mindset.  Excellent communication and presentation skills to interface with cross-functional partners, alliance partners, and senior management Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills Self-motivated, ability to work independently and without significant management oversight Ability to lead, influence, and work in a complex and cross-functional environment regardless of reporting structure Ongoing investment in developing self and others to deliver ambitious goals Understand, respect and abide by all local rules and regulations pertaining to pursuing pharmaceutical activities

Education & Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree required, advanced degree preferred, IT or analytical/math education emphasis preferred

IMMUNOCORE VALUES

 We lead with science to benefit patients We are entrepreneurial We value diversity to drive innovation We respect each other and act with integrity We do the right thing

WORK AUTHORIZATION/SECURITY CLEARANCE (IF APPLICABLE)

Work authorization and/or a valid passport is required for this role.

WORK ENVIRONMENT

This job will be located in Immunocore's Rockville, MD location

Drives innovative project and company performance improvement solutions, including corrective and preventive (CAPA) actions, as needed. Perform risk-based quality content reviews and monitor internal/external KPIs, as required by the client.Contributes to Corporate Initiatives, e.g., SOP development and proposals for government and commercial clients.

Seasoned oral and written communication skills.Expertise in Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, and Excel is required, and experience with Microsoft Project.Background in Infectious Disease/HIV clinical trials and/or Oncology preferred; prior work on a government contract, is a plus.

title: Sr-Level Scientist / Project Manager
description:
Sr-Level Scientist / Project Manager
Environmental Research Group, LLC incl AmaTerra, ERG Texas Services. Founded in 2000, ERG is an environmental consulting small business providing National Environmental Policy Act (NEPA), Cultural Resources, Natural Resources, Compliance, Restoration, and Geographical Information Systems (GIS) services to federal, state, local/municipal, and commercial clients across the United States. ERG is headquartered in Baltimore, Maryland, and operates AmaTerra, ERG Texas Services, out of Austin, Texas to provide Texas state-wide services. We are a value-driven, employee-first company. Trust, expertise, and compassion guide our success, as we serve with gratitude, joy, and adaptability.We are a Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned (SDVO), Disadvantaged/Woman Owned Business Enterprise (DBE, WO/WBE) Small (Environmental Consulting) Business.
Requirements 
BS in Environmental Science, or related field. At least 10 years of environmental experience/CERCLA experience, knowledge of the Clean Up program, Project Management Plan, Cleanup Program Technical Support, Program Document Review Support, Briefings, Restoration Advisory Board (RAB) Support, Correspondence Support, Confirmation Notices and After Action Reports, Cleanup Program Binder and Summary Report, and Comment Response Package.
Picatinny Arsenal (PICA) is a joint service armament research and development center. It provides virtually all of the lethal mechanisms used in Army weapon systems and those of the other military services. PICA is a Department of Defense (DoD) Joint Center of Excellence for Guns and Ammunition providing life cycle research, development, and acquisition support to each of our nation's military services. This includes production, field engineering support, and demilitarization of munitions, weapons, fire control and assigned items. PICA is home to a number of tenant organizations including the Joint Program Executive Office for Armaments and Ammunition (JPEO A&A), US Army Combat Capabilities Development Command-Armaments Center (DEVCOM-AC), Development and Engineering Center, Joint Munitions and Lethality Life Cycle Management Command, IMCOM, and a number of smaller organizations most of which are involved in the materiel acquisition field. Currently, design, development and engineering support are the principal functions performed at Picatinny. Production is limited to fabricating and manufacturing small quantity prototypes for testing and procurement. As a part of the development and testing process, the installation stores various types of ammunition and explosives in specially designed bunkers. The storage of ammunition and explosives creates safety and security risks that limit access and restrict use of certain parts of the land base.
Picatinny Arsenal (PICA), New Jersey is under Installation Management Command-ID-Sustainment and lies just west of the greater New York/New Jersey Metropolitan Area, 32 miles northwest of Newark and 42 miles west of New York City.
ERG, LLC is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability or protected veteran status. We participate in the E-Verify Employment Verification Program.

title: SFT - Software Engineer I
description:
Overview

Employees at Pinnacle 21 do tech work that means something. Their software enables key transitions in the clinical trial data pipeline and streamlines regulatory approvals for drugs and medical devices, getting new treatments to patients faster. Pinnacle 21 supplies its SaaS platform to the US FDA, Japan’s PMDA, 22 of the top 25 biopharma firms, and many more biotechs. It ensures clinical trial data comply with the standards of both government agencies and trial sponsors. On its way from the clinic to a government agency, a data point goes through many steps, and Pinnacle 21 has processed over 30 trillion (with a T!) of them. With strong product-market fit and an aggressive roadmap fueled by their 2021 acquisition by Certara (NASDAQ: CERT), the team is quickly becoming the one-stop data brokerage for the life sciences.

Our engineers are working to solve complex problems in clinical data processing, standardization, and integration. You will be part of an agile team that is responsible for designing, developing, testing, maintaining, and improving your projects.

You will be encouraged to exceed expectations, which is a requirement to succeed in a small team that is constantly working on new challenges.

You will not be limited to the back-end and will be given plenty of opportunities to learn and contribute on the full stack. You will have a chance to research new technologies if they are the best solution to a problem, but you will also be expected to learn and use existing solutions when it makes sense.

You will be working within a team of highly accomplished software engineers in an environment which actively encourages collaboration and learning from one another. The leadership team is committed to supporting you in your learning and development and helping you to further advance your career. For all entry-level engineers, we provide added support to help you adjust to your new career. We have an early career lunch and learn program supported by senior members of the team and on-the-job training supported by your manager.

To empower our developers, we will equip you with the best hardware and software available.

Responsibilities

Develop and maintain features in software applications using Java, JavaScript, and PostgreSQLUnderstand and apply applicable coding standardsCollaborate with members of the product, test, and software engineering organizationsWrite unit tests as appropriate to new functionalityParticipate in code and software review processes

Qualifications

No specific educational or experience requirements. Technical aptitudes to be evaluated during assessment proccess. This is an entry-level position generally appropriate for people with 0-2 years of experience in the software field.

This is a hybrid role on-site in Blue Bell OR Radnor, PA.

Certara bases all employment-related decision on merit, taking into consideration qualifications, skills, achievement, and performance. We treat all applicants and employees without regard to personal characteristics such as race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, nationality, marital status, pregnancy, physical or mental condition, genetic information, military service, or other characteristic protected by law.

title: Technical Enablement Architect
description:
About Ping Identity:

At Ping Identity, we believe in making digital experiences both secure and seamless for all users, without compromise. We call this digital freedom. And it's not just something we provide our customers. It's something that inspires our company. People don't come here to join a culture that's built on digital freedom. They come to cultivate it.

Our intelligent, cloud identity platform lets people shop, work, bank, and interact wherever and however they want. Without friction. Without fear.

While protecting digital identities is at the core of our technology, protecting individual identities is at the core of our culture. We champion every identity. One of our core values, Respect Diversity, reminds us to celebrate differences so you are empowered to bring your authentic self to work.

We're headquartered in Denver, Colorado and we have offices and employees around the globe. We serve the largest, most demanding enterprises worldwide, including more than half of the Fortune 100. At Ping Identity, we're changing the way people and businesses think about cybersecurity, digital experiences, and identity and access management.

The Role

With a passion for Ping products and services, the Technical Enablement Architect will work closely with our Sales Enablement, Business Value, Product, and Engineering teams to educate and influence technical audiences (with a little bit of fun possibly included) about how Ping is championing identities on an everyday basis. The goal of this role is to execute on our mission of equipping Ping Identians and our Partner network with the business, technical skills and industry knowledge to create, deploy and maintain world class identity solutions, and our vision of empowering Ping Identity’s technical field to create solutions for customers’ complex identity and access management challenges.

The Team

As a Tech Enablement Architect at Ping Identity, you will play a key role in being a member of a world-class centralized Technical Enablement team, supporting highly effective global sales engineering teams and our Partner network . The Technical Enablement team fosters the cultural synergy between sales engineering, selling pods and product engineering to be at the forefront of the latest and greatest at Ping. This role will report into the Sr Director, Tech Enablement, and will collaborate with Tech Enablement Architect, Team Lead, for all everyday tasks and activities..

Responsibilities

Constantly iterate and implement the Technical Enablement Program vision as defined by Sr Director of Technical EnablementWork with Product Leaders and Field SMEs to optimize product messaging on how Ping’s technology brings value add to enterprises and end users alike to audiences of varying experiencesLearn, configure and deploy demo and POC environments as it relates to Ping products and servicesBe as a subject matter expert and support live / recorded onboarding and ongoing Sales and Technical Enablement eventsUpdate tools, training and resource materials for all live / recorded onboarding and ongoing Technical Enablement programsCollaborate effectively with leadership and cross-functional stakeholders to scale existing or build new training and knowledge sharing programsPlan, deliver, host, participate, execute, and support real-time live and virtual events hosted by the Sales and Tech Enablement Team, such as Kick-Off, Mid-Year QBRs, Onboarding ProgramsBe an active participant in all of the Enablement Programs


Required Skills

title: Supply Technician Lead (SSMO)
description:
Overview

Working across the globe, V2X builds smart solutions designed to integrate physical and digital infrastructure from base to battlefield. We bring 120 years of successful mission support to improve security, streamline logistics, and enhance readiness. Aligned around a shared purpose, our $3.9B company and 16,000 people work alongside our clients, here and abroad, to tackle their most complex challenges with integrity, respect, responsibility, and professionalism.

The Supply Technician Lead performs aspects of technical supply management work (e.g., inventory management, storage management, cataloging, and property utilization) related to depot, local, or other supply activities Assists Subsistence Supervisor in administration, training and counseling of employees within the SSMO.

Responsibilities

This position description is subject to change at any time as needed to meet the requirements of the program or company.

 MAJOR JOB ACTIVITIES: 

 Responsible for posting to registers and ledgers.  Balance and reconcile accounts.  Notify Supervisor of any issues or discrepancies.  The Supply Technician Lead receives guidance and direction as necessary from the Supervisor with regards to policies, directives and professional development.  Have a clear understanding of the Standard Operating Procedures (SOP).  Complete all assigned tasks directed by supervisor.  The work generally involves individual case problems or supply actions.  Assist SSMO Supervisor is the operation of the administration office.  Must possess knowledge of standardized supply regulations, policies, and procedures or other written or verbal instructions relating to receipt and/or issue of stock or and should possess the ability to perform a range of standard and non-standard clerical assignments and resolve recurring problems.  Utilizes the Army Food Management Information System (AFMIS) automated system to process all transactions.  Must have access and knowledge of the Subsistence Total Order Receipt Electronic System (STORES).  Download catalog from STORES upload to AFMIS and forward to customers.  Maintains files for accountability IAW Army Records Information Management System (ARMIS).  Must have the ability to multitask and make quick decisions as needed.  Responsible for customers requesting rations for field training and input request into AFMIS for ordering and issue.  Assist in forwarding warrior restaurants (WRs) prime vendors and direct vendor delivery orders through STORES and posting receipts in AFMIS in a timely manner to ensure DFACs can conduct account and inventory reports.  Assist in providing WRs with monthly prime vendor’s and direct vendor delivery submission schedule.  Reconcile accounts with dining facility managers for accuracy before monthly close-out.  Assist customers with item identification, unusual requirements, account closing, orders and receipts.  Determines reasons for rejections and prepare necessary correcting material.  Assist with training of personnel in administration functions.  Performs other duties as assigned by management. 

 MATERIAL & EQUIPMENT DIRECTLY USED: 

 Computers, Fax machine, Copier, Printer and Phones.  Personal computer systems, Microsoft Office Programs, any other pertinent software and general office equipment.  Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) is required in certain areas while work is being conducted. Such PPE includes, but is not limited to: Face Mask, head, foot, hand, vision and hearing protective devices.  Use of Government Furnished vehicle.  Must comply with all Fire and Safety Regulations and post policies. 

 WORKING ENVIRONMENT: 

 Work will typically be in a temperature-controlled office environment, with frequent exposure to electronic office equipment. T  There may be times when an employee is exposed to extreme cold weather conditions. 

Qualifications

 MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: 

 EDUCATION/CERTIFICATIONS: 

 High School Diploma or equivalent  Must be able to obtain and maintain a Common Access Card (CAC)  Valid Driver’s License.  Must be able to provide proof of U.S. Citizenship, such as a birth certificate or a U.S. Passport.  Must maintain driving privileges aboard the Fort Liberty Installation.  Must be able to pass a pre-employee drug screen.  Must be able to pass a pre-employment background check. 

 EXPERIENCE: 

 Five years' experience on supply operations at the property book level  Must have technical experience and comprehensive knowledge of Government regulations, policies and procedures.  Must have comprehensive knowledge of the applicable supply and equipment management processes, related.  Regulation, and is required to ensure effective accountability of all assigned property.  Ability to prioritize, and multi-task in a fast-paced environment, and interact at all levels.  Ability to work independently with minimal supervision; ability to work in a team-based, highly collaborative environment.  Capacity to work well under pressure and tight deadlines.  Excellent organizational skills, ability to prioritize, perform with a high degree of accuracy and multi-task in a fast-paced environment.  Specific contractual requirements regarding education and experience prevail where applicable. 

SKILLS:

 Proficient with Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point, Access, Project and SharePoint preferred.

title: Gas and Electric Utility Client Account Manager
description:
Job Description

 Take Your Business Development and Marketing Career to the Next Level 

Kleinfelder’s business development and marketing professionals help communicate innovative solutions. From identifying opportunities to developing winning strategies, they know how to leverage relationships, build new ones, and collaborate across areas, service lines, and markets. Are you interested in the opportunity to lead large-scale project opportunities? Join Kleinfelder and be part of our dynamic team!

Step Into Your New Role

 Kleinfelder is looking for highly motivated and experienced  Gas and Electric Utility  Client Account Manager to join our fantastic team in the SoCal Region.  We are excited to present a challenging opportunity for an experienced and energetic person to help shape Kleinfelder’s future in the Energy Utility Market. This candidate will foster relationships with top utility clients, work closely with local operations, and will assist in the development of client-centric delivery teams that will position us for extraordinary growth in the years to come. Primary focus will be on senior level client engagement, overall market leadership, and development of teams centered on cross selling services to key client accounts. This position can sit in Los Angeles or San Diego.

The selected candidate will work in our team-oriented environment, primarily providing business/client development by developing and leading Strategic Growth Plan for our Utility partners in SoCal Northeast . He or she will focus on expanding and diversifying Kleinfelder’s SoCal operation by: providing direct coaching, mentoring, training and career pathing to regional and divisional Client Account Managers (CAMs) focused on growth with key clients, introducing new clients and opportunities, cross-selling new services to existing Clients, and providing business development leadership. This is an excellent growth opportunity for an individual with an established network of Clients, looking to take a very reputable operation to the next level.

 Specific expectations will include: 

 Strong verbal and written communication skills and a proven talent at business development.  Client service management skills and proposal preparation experience.  Strong team building and communications skills.  Working knowledge of project management systems, project scheduling, scoping, budgeting, cost analyses, resource analyses, and reporting.  Understands our clients’ business and develops innovative solutions and sound recommendations to meet their needs. Identifies and develops project opportunities for new work and/or expanded services for new and established clients.  Identifies opportunities and takes action to build relationships between one's area and other areas, teams, departments, units, or organizations to help achieve business goals; shares information and solicits feedback.  Handles customer questions and complaints, communicates with customers, handles service problems politely and efficiently, always available for customers, follows procedure to solve customer problems, understands company products and services, maintains pleasant and professional image.  Recognizes problems and responds, systematically gathers information, sorts through complex issues, seeks input from others, addresses root cause of issues, makes timely decisions, can make difficult decisions, uses consensus when possible, and communicates decisions to others.  Knows the organization’s mission and functions, and how its social, political and technological systems work and operate effectively within them; this includes the programs, policies, procedures, rules, and regulations of the organization.  Develops proposal strategies that utilize Company’s strengths and innovative thinking to gain a competitive advantage. 

 Job responsibilities: 

 Providing inspirational, business, market and professional development leadership;  Providing safety leadership and stewardship;  Collaborating and connecting with KLF internal resources to ensure our SoCal Team is fully knowledgeable and equipped to cross-sell our full suite of solutions to our clients;  Providing team oriented, “fit for purpose” solutions to meet our clients’ expectations;  Assessing risks and managing the risk appropriately for both Kleinfelder and our clients;  In collaboration with Senior & Technical Leadership, and Recruiters, recruiting and retaining exceptional talent to the team;  Significant experience with developing new business pursuits and a solid client base in SoCal.  Drive sales from a select group of targeted clients.  Develop and maintain strong relationships with clients in providing engineering and professional consulting services.  The ability to work well in a matrixed environment, interacting with both business development and operations teams, as well as maintaining close communications with the client to represent their needs effectively.  Leading positioning and proposal efforts to grow the business.  Mentoring staff to successfully deliver technical projects and enhance growth mentality in the group; 

 Qualifications: 

 Bachelor of Science, Engineering, or related technical field.  12+ years of related experience, 4-5 years of direct client interaction in the energy market and knowledge of applicable laws and regulations,4+ years of sales experience required.  Masters of Science in Engineering is a plus.  Professional Engineer License a plus. 

 Move Forward with Kleinfelder 

Kleinfelder has been connecting great people to the best work since 1961. We are engineers, scientists, and construction professionals providing solutions that improve our clients’ transportation, water, energy, and other private infrastructure. As a responsive, cross-disciplinary team of bright, curious, and innovative problem-solvers, we are dedicated to doing the right thing, every day, on every project from over 85 offices in the US, Canada, and Australia. Connecting great people to the best work is our purpose – together, we deliver.

 Progress with an Employer that Values You 

Kleinfelder is an inclusive organization free from discrimination. We are a stronger organization when we are a diverse workforce and believe that through diversity, equity, and inclusion comes creativity, innovation, and unity. We are proud to offer the following:

 Benefits: Kleinfelder offers an excellent compensation and benefits package, including: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401(k) plan, and paid holidays. The expected salary range for the position is displayed in accordance with the California Equal Pay Acts. Final agreed upon compensation is based upon individual qualifications and experience. Salary range: $138,967 - 156,881.

 Career Development:  We are committed to investing in the professional development of our staff, offering each employee every opportunity to grow, develop, and take control of their career paths. We support these efforts through reimbursements for continuing education as well as many of the expenses associated with trainings and certifications, and opportunities for career development through our internal Mentoring Program.

 Equal Opportunity:  Kleinfelder is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Minorities/Women/Disabled/Veterans. (Compliant with the new VEVRAA and Section 503 rules)

 NOTICE TO THIRD PARTY AGENCIES  

Please note that Kleinfelder does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Fee Agreement, Kleinfelder will not consider or agree to payment for any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, Kleinfelder explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resume, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Kleinfelder.

title: BIM Product Manager
description:
Job Description

MiTek is a platform innovator and enabler that exists to transform the building industry with better building solutions. In 1955, MiTek transformed residential construction with the invention of the Gang-Nail plate and a digital platform that provided an affordable and scalable way to manufacture wood trusses. Today, MiTek delivers software, services, engineered products, and automated solutions that enable the building industry to improve efficiencies by optimizing the balance between off-site and on-site. With nearly 5,600 team members worldwide, MiTek collaborates across the building industry to enable and accelerate transformational breakthroughs in design and construction to transform the way the industry designs, makes, and builds. As a Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE: BRK-A, NYSE: BRK-B) company since 2001, MiTek has a record of continuous growth and innovation. Learn more at www.mii.com.

Summary

Responsible for owning and controlling direction of BIM components of the MiTek Design Engagement software solutions. Works directly with various Design Engagement Product Managers on short and long-term planning on both existing and new Design Engagement software solutions. Responsible for writing operational requirements for Design Engagement BIM software solutions including design, documentation and verification of features and functionality. Oversees the development of project information models which contain 3D visualizations to bring together data and drawings, provides insight into development of structural construction documents (i.e. plan view, sections, details, schedules, etc.); and provides technical assistance and training in support of these features and functionality. Works directly with customers to determine market needs, run customer research efforts including usability testing, and to determine competitive environment needs. Is an active and critical member of an Agile Development scrum team within software development process and is a key part of the decision-making group to assess risk of various projects alongside project manager, software developers, QA managers, and other stakeholders such as the Product Portfolio Manager for Design Solutions.

Job Responsibilities & Requirements

RESPONSIBILITIES:


Product OwnershipExperience delivering successful outcomes for software projects across the software development life cycle to a deadline.Understands all aspects of the Software Development Lifecycle and applies that knowledge effectively as a product managerLeads and owns a Software Product and/or Software Projects within MiTek’s Software offerings Oversee and drive project timing and deliveries across a ProjectLeads and owns a subsystem in a complex product in development and/or leads a complex projectOversees and owns Backlog maintenance of Product and/or Projects Oversees and develops User Stories/Requirements for Project and Product needsOwns and creates vision planning for Projects and/or subset of ProductOwns specific area of logic in a complex product/project or oversees the entirety of ownership over a smaller product/project. 




Customer Relationship Key contributor towards customer discovery efforts and customer exchanges Creates and leads various customer exchanges 




Domain KnowledgeAbility to rapidly gain domain expertise both locally and globallyRecognized as an expert in a portion of the offerings you oversee 




Leadership Occasionally mentors Software interns or new Associate Software Product Managers 


QUALIFICATIONS:


Experience in BIM and structural construction documentation requiredPrevious experience as an Architect, Engineer of Record (EOR), or BIM Manager highly preferred5-10 years experience in light-framed multi-dwelling wood construction preferredExperience with Autodesk Revit highly preferredExperience in UX usability principals preferredExperience working in a software development environment preferredFamiliarity with Product Management methodologies desired Passion to learn new technologies, and brainstorm broad applications or ideas with a wide range of stakeholders and customers Ability to foster new and existing relationships with a variety of personality types Strong communication skills to interact frequently with stakeholders and clients.Proficiency with Microsoft Office (Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, etc.)Familiarity with software development environments like C# or Visual Basic .NET is beneficial but not required


MiTek Perks:


Flexible Paid Time Off - take as much time off as you need!All Benefits begin on Day 1!Profit Sharing Plan and Annual Incentive Plan13 Paid Holidays401k Plan with Matching ContributionsA variety of Medical, Dental and Vision Plans to choose fromShort-Term Disability and Life InsuranceTuition Reimbursement Career advancement and training opportunities!


In compliance with the Colorado Equal Pay For Equal Work Act, the pay range for this position is estimated at $85k-$125k/year. Base pay offered may vary based on job-related knowledge, skills and experience. Please visit www.mii.com/about/careers/ to learn more about MiTek’s benefit opportunities.

title: Senior Financial Planning Analyst
description:
Job Description

MiTek is a platform innovator and enabler that exists to transform the building industry with better building solutions. In 1955, MiTek transformed residential construction with the invention of the Gang-Nail plate and a digital platform that provided an affordable and scalable way to manufacture wood trusses. Today, MiTek delivers software, services, engineered products, and automated solutions that enable the building industry to improve efficiencies by optimizing the balance between off-site and on-site. With nearly 5,600 team members worldwide, MiTek collaborates across the building industry to enable and accelerate transformational breakthroughs in design and construction to transform the way the industry designs, makes, and builds. As a Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE: BRK-A, NYSE: BRK-B) company since 2001, MiTek has a record of continuous growth and innovation. Learn more at www.mii.com.

Summary

Responsible for providing objective and comprehensive analytical support by forecasting, financial modeling, coordinating variance analysis, and performing special project work to support the objectives and initiatives of the financial and operational functions of MiTek. This role will work to build strong partnerships across the organization, track and report on financial performance, as well as provide analysis and guidance to support opportunities.

Job Responsibilities & Requirements

What you will do


Financial Planning: Support the annual budgeting process, collaborating with various verticals to gather accurate and comprehensive financial forecasts. Develop and maintain detailed financial models to support long-term strategic planning and scenario analysis.Forecasting and Analysis: Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial forecasts, highlighting key drivers and variances. Conduct in-depth financial analysis to identify trends, risks, and opportunities, providing actionable insights to leadership.Management Reporting: Generate and deliver timely and accurate financial reports to senior leadership, highlighting performance against budget and KPIs. Work closely with FP&A leaders to understand and communicate financial results.Business Partnering: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business drivers and provide financial guidance. Partner with operational teams to develop financial metrics that align with strategic objectives.Cost Management: Analyze cost structures and identify areas for cost optimization and efficiency improvements. Provide recommendations for resource allocation and budget reallocations based on business priorities.Financial Modeling: Develop and maintain sophisticated financial models to support strategic initiatives, capital projects, and investment decisions. Conduct sensitivity analysis and scenario planning to assess potential impacts on financial performance.


Qualifications


Bachelors Finance required orBachelors Accounting required orBachelors Related Field required4+ Years Experience in financial planning and analysis roles preferredAble to use Microsoft Office Applications


Soft Skills


Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and financial modeling.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.Excellent communication and presentation skills.Experience with ERP systems and financial planning software.Strategic Thinker: Ability to see the big picture and translate it into actionable financial strategies.Collaborative: Works effectively with cross-functional teams and communicates financial concepts to non-finance stakeholders.Proactive: Takes initiative and anticipates the financial needs of the organization.Adaptable: Thrives in a fast-paced environment and adapts to changing priorities.


Additional Requirements


5% Site visits


Physical Demands

This role is performed in an office environment where a computer, telephone and other office equipment are used as needed to perform the duties of the role.

title: National Tech Rep
description:
Job Description

MiTek is a platform innovator and enabler that exists to transform the building industry with better building solutions. In 1955, MiTek transformed residential construction with the invention of the Gang-Nail plate and a digital platform that provided an affordable and scalable way to manufacture wood trusses. Today, MiTek delivers software, services, engineered products, and automated solutions that enable the building industry to improve efficiencies by optimizing the balance between off-site and on-site. With nearly 5,600 team members worldwide, MiTek collaborates across the building industry to enable and accelerate transformational breakthroughs in design and construction to transform the way the industry designs, makes, and builds. As a Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE: BRK-A, NYSE: BRK-B) company since 2001, MiTek has a record of continuous growth and innovation. Learn more at www.mii.com.

Summary

Will install, provide training, troubleshoot problems, and provide support of complex Structural Engineering, CAD, and Business Management applications within the MiTek Software Suite at our customer locations. In addition the National Technical Representative acts as a liaison to the customer to provide software support and training, consultation to improve customer productivity and overall business operations using the MiTek software. Assistance shall include installation, system configuration, network interaction, feature usage, enhancement needs and system behavior.

Job Responsibilities & Requirements

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:


Travel nationally to customer sites to provide software training and provide support of complex Structural Engineering, CAD, and Business Management applications within the MiTek Software Suite.This role would be concentrating on training and education of wall panel design using MiTek software.Researches unsolved open software cases and provides solutions to customers.Collaborate with Product Management and Software Development to ensure proper correction of defects and implementation of enhancements into the software.Collaborate directly with Technical Documentation Group to assist with development of training materials to be provided to customer.Maintain records of daily data communication transactions, problems, and remedial actions taken as well as installation activities using Salesforce.Collaborate with staff, users, and management to examine more critical issues with the MiTek software.


SKILLS & ABILITIES:


Education: Associate's Degree (two year college or technical school) preferred.Experience: Four plus years related experience in wall panel design and production.Familiar with MiTek SAPPHIRE Structure software, and AutoCAD preferred.Knowledge and experience with Microsoft Windows Operating Systems and various networking environments required. Knowledge of Terminal Server/Citrix environments, SQL along with query and report writing preferred.Ability to interact at a high level of professionalism with others; including co-workers, vendors and customers.Attendance during regular work hours and overtime required.

title: Design Engineer I
description:
Job Description

MiTek is a platform innovator and enabler that exists to transform the building industry with better building solutions. In 1955, MiTek transformed residential construction with the invention of the Gang-Nail plate and a digital platform that provided an affordable and scalable way to manufacture wood trusses. Today, MiTek delivers software, services, engineered products, and automated solutions that enable the building industry to improve efficiencies by optimizing the balance between off-site and on-site. With nearly 5,600 team members worldwide, MiTek collaborates across the building industry to enable and accelerate transformational breakthroughs in design and construction to transform the way the industry designs, makes, and builds. As a Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE: BRK-A, NYSE: BRK-B) company since 2001, MiTek has a record of continuous growth and innovation. Learn more at www.mii.com.

Summary

As a Design Engineer you will work closely with the engineering team, our national network of fabricators, and the project team of architects, engineers, and contractors to deliver high performance cold-formed steel solutions.

Job Responsibilities & Requirements

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:


Engineer cold-formed steel trusses, components, and ancillary framing for project specific applications – 20%Engineer repairs for cold-formed steel truss framing, bracing, and connections as required to address field conditions – 20%Engineer cold-formed steel truss systems design incorporating permanent truss bracing, temporary construction bracing where required, shear transfer blocking / bracing and lateral truss connections and other project specific requirements – 20%Engage with the other members of the engineering team to support the development of technical expertise and engineering judgement within the team through mentoring and collaboration. – 10%Collaboration and coordination with fabricators and project team architects, engineers, and contractors on project specific design requirements – 5%Develop customized connection details and engineered connections based upon project specific design requirements – 5%Engage with fabricator network to provide designers with engineering support and assist in developing technical training documents and technical reference material – 5%Collaborate with the engineering team to support the development of technical reference material and engineering design tools – 5%Collaboration with the software development team to support software analytical validation, performance assessment and enhancement development – 5%Support special engineering projects, strategic initiatives, and new product R&D initiatives – 5%Responsibly perform essential job functions and additional accountabilities with direction from leadership and oversight as appropriate.Individuals are preferred to have passed the Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) exam, are highly encouraged to pursue registration as a Professional Engineer (P.E.) and it is desirable to pursue registration as and Structural Engineer (S.E.).Individuals are encouraged to participate in professional industry associations, code committees, etc. 


SKILLS & ABILITIES:


Education: Bachelor's Degree in Engineering from an ABET accredited University in Civil/Structural or Architectural Engineering (Structural). Experience: 0-2 years of engineering experience in civil / structural engineering and knowledge of the building construction industry, obtained through a combination of experience and education. Cold-formed steel knowledge and design experience desirable.Computer Skills: MS Office suite of products. AutoCAD or other drafting software experience desirable. Other Requirements: Passed the Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) exam preferred. Registration as a Professional Engineer (PE) highly encouraged. Displays strong ability to work independently with direction and oversight.
